hero.welcome: Welcome to Source of Life Theological College
hero.title: Equipping Believers for Truth, Mission, and Faithful Witness
hero.subtitle: Christ-centered theological education with strong emphasis on Christian apologetics, mission, and interfaith engagement.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to equip and empower students to explore, understand, and clearly articulate the core doctrines of the Christian faith while engaging other belief systems with wisdom, confidence, and Christ-like compassion. We are committed to raising believers who can defend their faith biblically and intellectually while promoting peace, truth, and understanding across cultures.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: We envision Source of Life Theological College as a leading institution in theological education and Christian apologetics‚Äîrecognized locally and internationally for academic excellence, spiritual formation, and transformative community impact. Our vision is to develop servant leaders who uphold biblical truth, demonstrate Christ‚Äôs love, and contribute meaningfully to a multicultural and multi-faith world.

goals.title: Goals
goals.description: The primary goal of the College is to develop spiritually grounded and intellectually equipped Christian leaders who are deeply rooted in biblical theology and proficient in apologetics. Special emphasis is placed on preparing students to respond thoughtfully and respectfully to questions and challenges related to Christian faith, particularly in dialogue with World Religions theology.

theologicalEducation.title: Comprehensive Theological Education
theologicalEducation.description: To deliver a rigorous and balanced curriculum in biblical studies, systematic theology, comparative religion, and Christian apologetics.

spiritualFormation.title: Spiritual Formation and Discipleship
spiritualFormation.description: To nurture spiritual maturity through mentorship, prayer, worship, and active participation in Christian community life.

interfaithEngagement.title: Cultural and Interfaith Engagement
interfaithEngagement.description: To equip students with a deep understanding of World Religions beliefs and practices, fostering respectful dialogue and informed engagement.

missionLeadership.title: Mission and Leadership Preparation
missionLeadership.description: To prepare students for effective ministry and mission work that promotes reconciliation, evangelism, and interfaith understanding.

programs.title: Academic Programs
programs.subtitle: Choose from our comprehensive range of programs designed for your calling

bachelor.description: Undergraduate programs developing spiritually grounded and intellectually equipped Christian leaders.

master.title: Master Degree Programs
master.description: Advanced theological and ministry leadership programs for pastors, teachers, and Christian leaders seeking deeper impact.

diploma.description: Comprehensive program in biblical studies, systematic theology, and ministry leadership.

theologicalStudies.title: Theological Studies
theologicalStudies.description: In-depth instruction in Christian theology, biblical doctrine, and comparative religion, emphasizing doctrinal clarity and biblical accuracy, combined with practical ministry exposure.

apologetics.title: Apologetics & Faith Defense
apologetics.description: Specialized training in Christian apologetics, equipping students to respond to objections, misconceptions, and theological challenges‚Äîparticularly those arising from World Religions teachings.

mission.title: Mission & Practical Ministry
mission.description: Hands-on mission engagement and outreach activities designed to develop effective communication, cultural sensitivity, and gospel-centered service in diverse communities.

hero.title: About Us
hero.subtitle: Equipping Believers for Truth, Mission, and Faithful Witness

story.title: Our Story
story.description: Source of Life Theological College is a Christ-centered theological institution committed to equipping believers with a profound understanding of Christian doctrine and the practical skills required for effective apologetics and mission. The College cultivates a scholarly and spiritual learning environment that prepares students to engage thoughtfully and respectfully with diverse worldviews, with particular attention to comparative theology and faith-based dialogue.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Our mission is to equip and empower students to explore, understand, and clearly articulate the core doctrines of the Christian faith while engaging other belief systems with wisdom, confidence, and Christ-like compassion. We are committed to raising believers who can defend their faith biblically and intellectually while promoting peace, truth, and understanding across cultures.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: We envision Source of Life Theological College as a leading institution in theological education and Christian apologetics‚Äîrecognized locally and internationally for academic excellence, spiritual formation, and transformative community impact. Our vision is to develop servant leaders who uphold biblical truth, demonstrate Christ‚Äôs love, and contribute meaningfully to a multicultural and multi-faith world.

hero.title: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our programs, admissions, and student life

questions.q: What is Source of Life Theological College?
questions.a: Source of Life Theological College is a Bible college dedicated to equipping believers with solid biblical foundation and practical ministry skills for effective Kingdom service.

questions.q: Is Source of Life Theological College accredited?
questions.a: Yes, we are accredited by recognized theological accreditation bodies. Our programs meet high academic and spiritual standards.

questions.q: What makes Source of Life Theological College different from other Bible colleges?
questions.a: We combine rigorous biblical scholarship with practical ministry experience, emphasizing both spiritual formation and academic excellence in a supportive community environment.
We offer Bachelor of Theology, Diploma in Ministry, and Masters Degree programs.

questions.q: What languages are courses offered in?
questions.a: Programs are offered in English, Afaan Oromo, and Amharic.

questions.q: How long does it take to complete a program?
questions.a: Bachelor programs take 4 years, Diploma programs take 2 years.
Requirements include a high school diploma, statement of faith, recommendation letters, recent photograph, and ID copy.
Applications are accepted year-round with intakes in January, May, and September.
Yes, a non-refundable application processing fee is required.

questions.q: How much does it cost to attend?
questions.a: Tuition varies by program. Please contact admissions for details.

questions.q: Can I pay tuition in installments?
questions.a: Yes, flexible payment plans are available.

questions.q: Are there additional costs beyond tuition?
questions.a: Additional costs may include books, accommodation, and graduation fees.

cta.title: Still Have Questions?
cta.description: We're here to help! Contact our admissions team for personalized assistance.
